新华社北京2月15日电（记者马向菲、李博闻）世界反兴奋剂机构（WADA）15日宣布，他们与网球男单世界头号选手辛纳达成协议，后者因兴奋剂阳性被禁赛三个月。
2024年3月，辛纳两次被检测出违禁物质类固醇氯睾酮阳性。辛纳表示阳性结果是在他不知情的情况下，使用了理疗师在意大利购买到的、含有氯睾酮的非处方喷雾剂导致。国际网球诚信委员会认为辛纳“在此事件中无过错或疏忽”，没有给运动员禁赛处罚。WADA去年9月对此裁定提出上诉。
在15日的声明中，WADA表示双方达成共识，承认运动员并非故意使用兴奋剂，辛纳的运动能力并未受益，同时他的阳性结果是辅助人员疏忽造成。但同时WADA表示，根据规定，运动员对其辅助人员过失也负有一定责任，因此禁赛三个月是“比较合适的处罚”。

translated_text_excerpt:
Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, Feb. 15 (Reporters Ma Xiangfei and Li Bowen) - The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) announced on the 15th that they reached an agreement with the world's top tennis player Sinner. The latter was banned for three months due to positive doping.
In March 2024, Sinner tested positive for the prohibited substance steroid chlorotestosterone twice. Sinner said the positive result was due to the use of an over-the-counter spray containing chlorotestosterone purchased by a physiotherapist in Italy without his knowledge. The International Tennis Integrity Commission believes that Sinner “was not at fault or negligent in this incident” and did not ban the athlete. WADA appealed this ruling in September last year.
In a statement on the 15th, WADA stated that the two sides reached an agreement admitting that the athlete did not intentionally use stimulants, that Sinner's athletic ability did not benefit, and that his positive results were due to negligence on the part of support staff. However, at the same time, WADA said that according to regulations, athletes are also responsible for the negligence of their support personnel, so a three-month ban is a “more appropriate punishment.”
